title.rendered: How To Process eTA for Canada

content.rendered:
Some citizens from specific countries can acquire a Canada eTA, allowing them to travel to Canada only with a Canadian visa and an electronic Travel Authorization (eTA).

You might be curious: “What exactly is an eTA, and is it necessary for me?” Read on to learn everything you need to know about the Canada eTA.

What is an eTA?

An eTA stands for Electronic Travel Authorization. It is an electronic document that allows certain foreign nationals exempt from visa requirements to travel to or through Canada by air.

How do I get an eTA?

To obtain an eTA, eligible travellers must complete an online application and pay a processing fee. The application asks for personal and passport information and background information related to criminal history, health, and travel plans.

Once approved, the eTA is linked electronically to the traveller’s passport and remains valid for up to five years or until the passport expires, whichever comes first. Travellers must present their passports and a valid eTA to the airline before boarding their flight to Canada.

Who Can Apply for the eTA?

The following countries are required to have an eTA:

Countries Requiring eTA
Andorra Australia Austria
Bahamas Barbados Belgium
Anguilla Bermuda British Virgin Islands
Cayman Islands Falkland Islands (Malvinas) Gibraltar
Montserrat Pitcairn Island Saint Helena
Turks and Caicos Islands Brunei Darussalam Bulgaria
Chile Croatia Cyprus
Czech Republic Denmark Estonia
Finland France Germany
Greece Hong Kong Hungary
Iceland Ireland Israel
Italy Japan Republic of Korea
Latvia Liechtenstein Lithuania
Luxembourg Malta Mexico
Monaco Netherlands New Zealand
Norway Papua New Guinea Poland
Portugal Romania Samoa
San Marino Singapore Slovakia
Slovenia Solomon Islands Spain
Sweden Switzerland Taiwan
United Arab Emirates United States Vatican City State

eTA for Canada

Electronic Travel Authorization (eTA) is a requirement for foreigners from visa-exempt countries wishing to visit Canada. Your eTA is electronically linked to your passport.

You can stay in Canada for up to six months and enter the country multiple times. Your eTA, on the other hand, is valid for five years or until the expiration of your passport. Whichever scenario occurs first determines your credibility.

You can apply for a new eTA if your passport is the first to expire. If your eTA is approved, it will be electronically linked to your new passport.

Please remember that simply having an eTA does not guarantee admission to Canada. The border officer will have the final say on this.

How do I apply for an eTA for travel to Canada?

Applying for an eTA is a simple online process that only takes a few minutes. Most applicants receive their eTA approval (via email) within minutes. However, if you are required to submit supporting documents, some requests may take several days to process. It is best to obtain an eTA before booking a flight to Canada.

A CAD 7 eTA is required. Only one person can apply and pay at a time.

What documents must I submit with my eTA application?

You will need your passport, a credit card, and an email address to complete the form. You must also respond to a few questions.

Tips For Applying For eTA

  • Because one eTA application is for one individual, a family must complete one application for each family member.
  • Once you begin your eTA application, you must complete it in one sitting. This is because it is a time-sensitive application that must be completed within the time frame specified. You can, however, request more time during your application session. To do so, select the ‘continue session’ option.
  • Once you’ve completed the process and it was successful, you should receive your authorized eTA status via email. The email will include your eTA number. It should only take a few minutes to complete.
  • Please remember that you may be required to submit additional documents before being approved for an eTA. If so, you will be contacted with instructions within 72 hours of submitting your eTA application.
  • As a result, applying for your eTA first and then booking your flights is preferable.
  • Check that the passport number in your passport corresponds to the passport number in the email. Because the eTA is linked to your passport electronically,

Foreigner Travel Options to Canada

Working Holiday Visas;
The Working Holiday Visa (WHV) is a fantastic way to travel around Canada and earn money! Not only will you gain valuable Canadian work experience, but you will also have the opportunity to improve or learn new skills.

The WHV has certain requirements.
You must meet the following requirements to be eligible for WHV:

  • Valid passport;
  • Citizenship in one of the 35 participating countries;
  • $2,500 for initial expenses;
  • Health insurance;
  • Police clearance certificate;
  • Round-trip ticket or sufficient funds to cover one;
  • And no dependents.

Nations Participating in the Working Holiday Visa?

The following is a list of all the countries that participate in the Working Holiday Visa program:

Countries in the International Experience Canada (IEC) Program

  • Australia
  • Austria
  • Belgium
  • Chile
  • Costa Rica
  • Croatia
  • Czech Republic
  • Denmark
  • Estonia
  • France
  • Germany
  • Greece
  • Hong Kong
  • Ireland
  • Italy
  • Japan
  • Korea, Rep.
  • Latvia
  • Lithuania
  • Luxembourg
  • Mexico
  • Netherlands
  • New Zealand
  • Norway
  • Poland
  • Portugal
  • San Marino
  • Slovakia
  • Slovenia
  • Spain
  • Sweden
  • Switzerland
  • Taiwan
  • Ukraine
  • United Kingdom

Frequently Asked Questions About the eTA for Canada:

Who needs an eTA for Canada?

Travellers from visa-exempt countries flying to or transiting through Canada need an eTA. However, US citizens and travellers with valid Canadian visas do not need an eTA.

How do I apply for an eTA for Canada?

You can apply for an eTA through the Government of Canada website. You’ll need to fill out an application form, provide some personal and passport information, and pay a processing fee.

How long does it take to get an eTA for Canada?

Most eTA applications are processed within minutes, but it may take longer in some cases. It’s recommended that you apply for an eTA well before your trip to allow time for processing and avoid any delays.

How long is an eTA for Canada valid?

An eTA for Canada is typically valid for five years or until the passport, it’s linked to expires, whichever comes first. However, if your passport expires before the eTA, you must apply for a new one.

What happens if my eTA application is denied?

If your eTA application is denied, you must apply for a visitor visa. The visa application process is more involved and may take longer to process.

Can I enter Canada with just an eTA?

No, an eTA only allows you to travel to Canada by air. You’ll also need a valid passport and any other required travel documents. You must follow different procedures if travelling to Canada by land or sea.

What happens if my passport is lost or stolen?

If your passport, linked to your eTA, is lost or stolen, you must apply for a new eTA with your new passport information. It’s important to update your eTA information to avoid issues when travelling to Canada.
